Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Sully94534
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights on business, great rooms, clean, spacious and well maintained. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a clean place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mabbiss
Reviews.Content: I love to stay at this hotel.. everything is clean. The lady in charge of the buffet is so nice and kind, and she is always taking care of the food and cleanness. A delicious buffet !!!... The receptionists are very friendly, very helpful and with a beautiful smile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: jax848
Reviews.Content: This is a basic travelers hotel. Clean, comfortable-- felt safe. What made the trip memorable was the excellent desk help in the evenings with assistance for directions, shortcuts, best places to hang out, etc. I hope the management appreciates just how excellent their staff is.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jcmonogram
Reviews.Content: Arrived about noon for my stay. I was allowed early check-in. The free continental breakfast was very good. There was always free coffee in the lobby. Located right off the freeway. Lots of stores nearby. It was confusing to find the gym (it was located at the hotel next door). I was not allowed to get my priority points (for Holiday Inn) because I booked with priceline.com (which I never heard of before). Parking was free and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was OK, except for the bed”
Reviews.Author: HopAroundTheWorld
Reviews.Content: I liked everything about this place BUT the bed. Location was great (almost right off the freeway = convenient). Parking was plentiful and free, although can get a bit crowded on weekend evenings since it shared the lot with Denny's. Upon arrival, we were greeted by warm & friendly staff at the front desk. Breakfast area was small, but it has pretty good selection at the buffet (just not a fan of their scrambled egg). The room itself was spacious and clean. Loved the mini fridge. Furniture (sofa) seems a bit outdated but that didn't bother me. What bothered me was - you guessed it - the bed itself. It had no support whatsoever. It's either an extremely old spring mattress or an extremely cheap quality mattress (like those advertised for $200-300 at Macy's sale events). It was mildly supportive on the edges but as I moved closer towards the center I started sinking in. I didn't want to fall off the bed by sleeping so close to the edge. I felt tortured, waking up with back ache every morning (thankfully I only stayed there for 2 nights). The couch was a bit too short for me, so I almost had to choose between a neck pain and a back pain. Internet connection: wireless is available for a fee, but it's such a pain to stay connected. Every short period of time it kicked me out of the session, even when I was staying active. It was very annoying to keep on having to supply password and renew session every 10-15 minutes when you're working, especially while using a VPN (then you'd have to reconnect your VPN session, even worse when you're using a remote desktop, that's another connection that needed to be reestablished). Some apps on my iPad doesn't even work because it couldn't see the verification page. Another thing: I know this is not a 5 star hotel & nor did I pay a 5 star rate, but it ticked me a bit when the housekeeping staff seemed to threw my PJ shirt off the bed side table. I didn't expect it to be folded crisp at even edges, but I didn't expect to see my shirt bundled like a ball on the side table either. I would think the least they could've done is to have placed it on the bed. I regret leaving tips, so I didn't even bother to leave another tip the next evening.

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF, HIDING CHARGES. POOR QUALITY”
Reviews.Author: Hector D
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at a military rate of 134.99 for one night. I check in and the room was stink, and smell like smoke. I am not a smoker. I had problem breathing and went to the clerk upfront who told that the hotel rooms were all sold. I had to sucked it up. Anyways, I did. Three days later I saw a 151.86 charge on my credit card. I mmediately called the hotel and the clerk told me that was taxes. I was like when i check in i told the clerk that i was on a miltary trip and asked if they charge military base on the perdiem rate. She was like, " Oh yes, we are military affiliated and we charge military base on thir rate. Well, just to let you know it was all lied, hiding charges, poor service, false advistment. stink hotel that do not charge what they claimed they will. The hotel cause me 81.86 out of my own pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality”
Reviews.Author: CharlieVVancouver
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler I seek out Holiday Inn Express hotels for the quality. My recent experience began with desk clerk who failed to recognize my loyalty as a Priority Member. The experience then continued with a total lack of ice in the entire four-story hotel, vending machines that were inoperable, and no change at the desk to purchase water or obtain ice. The high point was the excellent cleanliness of our room. Parking was slim with car having inches between them. The elevator was down several times in one day forcing us to walk the three flights. Thankfully it worked on our final day to bring our bags down. But upon attempting to check out at 4:30 AM the night clerk demanded to know why we were prepaid, “Expedia?”. I suggested she check our room record where she discovered we were prepaid. I then asked for a receipt as my confidence level was at a low ebb. This is a hotel that is far below the Holiday Inn Express standards.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with a personal touch...”
Reviews.Author: CWOSTEVE
Reviews.Content: The staff at HIE, Mira Mesa Blvd was phenominal. Chante was always wearing a smile for us and she did everything possible to accomodate our every need. I was in charge of 34 U.S. Marines that stayed at the hotel and each one of them had great things to say about the hotel and staff. We stayed at the hotel for almost an entire month and every day the rooms were immaculately cleaned. The breakfast was perfect and the coffee was made fresh! The manager in charge of making reservations was very understanding on the phone and she did everything possible to make our stay comfortable. Thank you very much from the Marines as MCAS Beaufort, SC.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Inn Express in San Diego County”
Reviews.Author: traveler10111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days on a trip down to San Diego. Loved this hotel. The location is great, not too far from downtown as well as if you wanted to go up north to Carlsbad and to Legoland. The rooms are very nice, clean and spacious. They recently upgraded the rooms to granite countertops as well as nice LCD flat panel tvs. They also have free wifi in each room. The hotel also serves complimentary breakfast and has a small eating area which was great. The staff was very friendly and nice. I would definately recommend this hotel for those who are traveling to San Diego/ Mira Mesa area for business or for pleasure. They give the best services and best hotel rates around!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL...WOULD DEFINITELY STAY AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladykulit
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, the hotel is right off the freeway (Highway 15)...it made getting around the city more convenient. The staff, especially at the front desk, were all friendly. Check in and check out were fast and easy. The rooms are spacious, clean, and well furnished. The rooms had a ref, microwave, hair dryer, and coffee maker. The beds were comfortable to sleep in. We slept really well even when the smoke alarm went off in the middle of the night since the battery needed to be changed. The sheets/linen were clean and seemed new. The parking lot gets somewhat crowded at night since they shared parking lots with Quality Inn Suites (right next door) and Dennys but it was not difficult to find parking spots. The complimentary breakfast was great. Hot foods were served such as biscuit and gravy, bacon, sausage, eggs, and warm cinnamon rolls. It made the stay even better. Overall our stay was very pleasant. The hotel was better than the expensive hotel we stayed at in Las Vegas. I definitely would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, QUIET, GREAT BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: Badgerdawg
Reviews.Content: Came down for my brother's funeral, this is close to his home. Very happy to report that our room was spotless, no smells, very clean bathroom, fresh linens, and the breakfast room was very clean with a great selection of food offered. Something for everyone. I have never seen biscuits and gravy at one of these before! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: raindroplsc
Reviews.Content: My husband was in town for work and I decided to take the kids. We have a 5 month old and a active 2 year old. So we updated to a suite which was wonderful. The room was spacious with a great room amenities. I love the fact that they had an extensive amount of tv channels for the kids and for myself since, we retired early and wanted to hang out in our rooml. Overall, I love the staff, the free breakfast buffet (plenty to select from), and location. The hotel was close enough for us to skip off to the beach within 20 minutes. They doing renovations, but it will not inconvenience you, since it done when most people are out.

Reviews.Title: “OK - not quite as good as reviews indicate”
Reviews.Author: SpringTexasUSA
Reviews.Content: Overall, we liked this hotel. It was clean, well cared for, and the breakfast was really good - kind of hard to find the breakfast room however. We arrived late at night and there was no parking - every single space was full. This hotel is joined onto another hotel and they both share the same parking lot. Basically, if they're full, which they were when we were there, there is not sufficient parking for all of thier customers. This was not helped by the presence of about 4 shipping containers using up a dozen or so parking spaces. I ended up parking next to the Denny's restaurant - made me a little nervous because I did not want to get towed. Also, this place is tricky to get to/from the airport. Airport access is horrible not matter where you're coming from or going to so... Again, overall the hotel is fine but I probably would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: lady2travels
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks lovely. We were in San Diego for my daughters graduation and it was seriously a great value. The frond desk young man told us they had just been renovated. They have brand new furniture, new queen mattresses, granite in the sinks and counters and beautiful clean carpet. We slept great while there. We also enjoyed the free breakfast which was hot and just perfect for out busy morning. The young man in the morning also did a great job giving us directions to a couple good restaurants in the area. Overall this hotel is great and i will definitely stay here on my next visit to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great location north of the city”
Reviews.Author: HockeyFan6
Reviews.Content: I did not need to be in downtown San Diego, so picked this location north of the city. It was very convenient, on a major road with plenty of restaurants and things to do, yet still only 10 minutes from the corporate park. Rooms were updated, with flat panel TV's (in an Express!!) that I often don't see in "grander" hotels. The beds were evidently brand new as well. The grounds were very nice - the hotel shares a lot with a Quality Suites, and the shared pool is in a beautiful courtyard - secluded from the suburban surroundings. I usually don't comment on price, but this hotel was very reasonable given the area and the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling clean, good service, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: KGone
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Holiday Inn Express. We were delighted with the overall service provided, the friendliness of the staff, and were especially impressed with the cleaniness of the entire facility. The Express is close to shopping and entertainment, but quite a trek to downtown San Diego. We give this hotel a "two thumbs up" and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but expensive, noisy”
Reviews.Author: TallMatthew
Reviews.Content: I should preface this by stating that before checking in to the hotel, I'd spent 4.5 hours in bumper-to-bumper traffic from LA getting there. I really needed a clean, quiet, comfortable room for the night and I didn't get it. First, the good: the room was immaculate, with comfortable bed linens. The hotel is well-situated in Mira Mesa, pretty much in the middle of San Diego. I personally would rather stay a little off the beaten path, if it means a quieter, more accessible stay. Now, the bad: The first thing I noticed was that there was only one person, a college-aged guy, working in the hotel. This was a problem, for in a hotel of that size (four stories), one that's completely booked, you're going to need more help than that. The hotel was *noisy*. I mean *noisy* As in cheaply-constructed garbage. It sounded like people were doing jumping jacks in the room upstairs. I spoke to the (overwhelmed) front desk person who implied that because I'd checked in using Orbitz (and prepaid), he didn't want to do anything about it. He refused to give me a room on the top floor, and only put me in a different room after I threatened to call his manager. Fortunately, the next room was OK, but I feel sorry for whomever had to sleep in the one I gave up. The next morning I woke up and called down to the front desk guy (who was clearly not happy with being bothered) and asked for more coffee packets. He told me there weren't any. I asked him if his manager would agree with that assessment when I spoke to her the next day. Magically, he found more coffee. It didn't matter, though--there was no hot water to shower and I was too ticked off at the place to stay another minute. I then arrived in the parking lot to find someone had stolen my hubcaps. Maybe I was a little too hard on the desk clerk. Or maybe one of the dozen or so college-aged kids staying unsupervised in the hotel, drinking and carrying on, thought I deserved it for runing their good mood. Unless you're on the top floor, I wouldn't recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at this hotel for the week we got married and we loved it. The front desk made a few mistakes with charging our credit card but they fixed it immediately and the staff were very friendly. I like the environment and was very clean. Whenever we needed something for our room or needed cleaning, it was done right away. There was a refrigerator, microwave coffeemaker, and blowdryer in the room without extra charge. The breakfast was complete and it was very satisfying. I like how there was a Denny's close to the hotel and was very convienient and the hotel gave us a 15% discount was as well. The hotel is convieniently close to many restaurants and a movie theater and just a few minutes drive from attractions and beaches. this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in and we would recommend it to others and will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May 2006 over Memorial Day weekend at 119.00 per night for the room. The check in went smoothly and the room was good sized and nicely appointed. I stayed at the Quality Suites in April 2006 and it is next door sharing the parking lot and a few amenities(swimming pool and weight room). The good thing about this hotel is that all the amenities are at the Quality Suites and so all of the noise is at that hotel. I would recommend staying at the Holiday Inn because it is much quieter and the rooms are nicer, even though it is a little more expensive than the Quality Suites. Would stay here again. Only complaint is because they share the parking lot, it can get really crowded and hard to find parking..Other than that, the breakfast is good and the workers are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was the closest to my relatives home. I read good reviews about this hotel from this website. The horrific part about this stay was I found a bug on my bed. When I contacted the front desk she explained its because they had military people and Japanese businessmen that stayed there. I informed her that every time I've stayed at hotels, and I do travel quite a bit, I have never discovered a bug in my room. I didn't think that excused them from not properly cleaning up their hotel especially at the amount I paid each night. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEMNYY18
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in San Diego. It is away from the attractions but all of the places to see are within a 10 or 15 min. drive (without traffic). It is located on Mira Mesa Blvd and is close to many restaurants and other name retailers. There is a movie theatre a few blocks away as well. The rooms were very spacious and clean and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. I will certainly stay at the hotel again when I travel there. There really wasn't anything bad about the hotel, only that the parking spaces outside were small. It is located next to a Denny's too. A great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: theflyfisher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express-Mira Mesa and were very happy. Finding the entrance after dark was a little confusing, but we soon became proficient at the California u-turn required. The hotel location is great for business in the Mira Mesa area and is close to MCAS Miramar. There are lots of stores and restaurants nearby. If you want to head to the beach, Old Town or major shopping in San Diego and other attractions access is easy enough if you don't mind the drive in on the highway. There are lots of other hotel options closer to those areas, but if the Mira Mesa area is where you need to be - this is a great choice. We had a great room, large with refrig and microwave. The breakfast was very complete with yogurt, waffles, cinnamon rolls, bagels, cereal, juice, hard boiled eggs, fruit. The reception staff were great, pleasant and professional. We had a change of plans and had to adjust our reservation. It was all handled smoothly, even though we had booked online through a travel service. Lots of sports teams stay at this hotel and that can cause a back-up at breakfast and a scarcity of ice - but all in all, we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 12/26 and had a great experience. The hotel is in a extremely quiet location with a Chilis restaurant on site. The room was very nice, new with great furnishings. Would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Express Mira Mesa
HotelInfo.Address: 9888 Mira Mesa Blvd, San Diego, CA 92131 (Formerly Mira Mesa Hotel)
